question: The term “Solar H-alpha” sometimes seen in the news, is related to which of the following?
explanation: The H-alpha telescope installed at the Kodaikanal Observatory in October 2014. It consists of an objective lens of 20 cm doublet that provides f/7.9 beam. With the additional optics, the telescope makes a full-disk image of the sun. The telescope is also capable of making the magnified view of the partial disk of the sun. The telescope is routinely taking the solar image in H-alpha wavelength.
